fields.description:
It would be great if the button between Save and Cancel could be spaced out.

The reason for this is because when the buttons are being too close, it could be possible that a user would click Cancel instead of Save by mistake. This could lead to lost in comments especially when the comments are large.

We could also include a pop up asking "Are you sure" when you try to click cancel on the comment.
fields.summary: Space out the button between Save and Cancel when commenting on a PR

fields.description:

So asking if it's related :

ping 104.192.143.x => works fine

but ping 18.205.93.x => is not working

Region in AWS is us-east..
fields.summary: cannot ping bitbucket ips from my AWS instance

core.packedGitWindowSize\\

pack.windowMemory

fields.description:
The Bitbucket server supports webhook secret, but the bitbucket cloud does not.

both gitlab and github also support webhook secret.

the public cloud is more vulnerable to DDOS, so webhook secret is a necessary security feature that Bitbucket cloud should support.

related issue:

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-83492
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud should support webhook secret.

fields.description: I open up a branch permission and select "allow deleting branch". When that happens It displays "An unexpected error occurred" and the permission does not change.

One of every 7 times they work using the same URL

There's no reason to limit this at the moment, so I'd like to request to either have a higher limit for this or have the limit removed entirely.

Thanks!

fields.summary: Cannot clone repository on Windows

fields.description: I created a new repository.  That went fine.  I then made a subdirectory, put some files into it, did an add, commit and push.  No apparent issues.  However, when I go to the BB web site, the folder is there but there are no files in the folder.  If I then return to the main repository on the web, the folder does not show.  A refresh of the main directory makes it show again.  What is clear is that BB knows about the files in the folder since if I do a pull on another machine, its gets them just fine.  Why they do not show is totally bizarre.  I have never seen this happen before.
fields.summary: Case of appearing and disappearing files

fields.description:
As stated here : [Deploy Key via API 1.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/deploy-keys-resource-296095243.html], is deprecated and will be removed permanently on 31st December 2018.

Currently the feature to add an access key via the REST API v2.0 is not available. It would be a nice feature to have when users could use for automated cloning of new repositories.
fields.summary: Ability to add Access Key via REST API v2.0

fields.description:
Hello,

I have transfered a repository from ProjectA to another user (I still have access rights). When I look at the repo i see a reference to ProjectA.

!333450679-exemple_bug.png|thumbnail!

There is a link on Project A wich is invalid : https://bitbucket.org/account/user/a-user-exemple/projects/CO (project itself doesnt seem to be created elsewhere in the UI).

Eric
fields.summary: Project name displayed in breadcrump when transfering from a team project.

fields.description:
I use Bitbucket to host my personal repositories and since I'm an individual user I'm not allowed to manage my repositories in projects. So I have to create a team with me as the only user in order to create projects, which doesn't make a lot of sense.

Individual users should be able to create and manage projects without having to be member in a team.
fields.summary: Projects for individual users

fields.description: As a developer it would be awesome to have an option directly on the bitbucket dashboard to request the creation of a new repository to the admin.
fields.summary: Request Repository Option

fields.description:
The current flow to change TOTP requires that the user completely disable ALL 2FA, reset the recovery codes unnecessarily, and doesn't make it clear that the user won't have to set up the security keys again once 2FA is re-enabled.

Instead of completely disabling 2FA (including security keys and recovery codes), just let the user click a button to show the QR code to register a new TOTP device, with some text explaining that the existing TOTP device will stop working once the new device is verified.

Something like this this would be less troublesome to the user. It would also make it more obvious how to set up a new TOTP device.
fields.summary: Changing the device used for TOTP 2FA is frustrating

fields.description:
!1269947128-2018-07-31%2015_46_19-itelios%20_%20smc%20_%20Administrateur%20_%20Strat%C3%A9gies%20de%20fusion%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket.png|thumbnail!

In french "Environment variables" should be "Variables d’environnement"
fields.summary: [Traduction][fr_FR] PIPELINES > Environment variables should be Variables d’environnement

fields.description: I had a problem with the default src/master and src/branch pointing to the wrong commits in my repo. As a bit of a noob, I decided to simply cut and paste my files to a new repo and delete the old one. However, when I rename the new repo to the old (deleted) repo name the problem returns! I can circumvent by simply having a different name for my new repo but I would really like to know what is going on here?

Any given plans on this topic?

fields.description:
Sometimes when I push a commit to the master branch of my repo, newly added files will be missing from my repo. And those that do show in the list of files, are not found.

!130922806-bug2.png|thumbnail!

When I return to the list of files and reload, then I'm shown an outdated list of files even with the master branch selected. It seems completely random.

I've already tried logging out and clearing my cache. Neither solves the problem.

*Edit:* It appears I can view the missing files through the commit history, just not from the branch file listing.

When transferring a repo, if using an e-mail address, Bitbucket does not find any users to transfer to, and instead requires the user which is transferring the repo to know the username of the receiving user.\\
!2119651216-Screen%20Shot%202018-07-30%20at%2016.29.59.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow repository transfers to use e-mail instead of only username

fields.description:
The Diff functionality of BitBucket doesn't seem to work with Lua scripts that have multi-line comments. Only the first change is shown. The entire remainder of the file is ignored.

For example, {{git show}} from the command line, shows over 25 changed lines to this file. But from the BitBucket interface, only the first changed line is displayed.

!1286731881-diff.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff fails with certain Lua files

fields.description: On deleting a file online the error comes as Repository [object Object]/reponame not found
fields.summary: Repo name is [object Object]

fields.description:
I have two branches: {{master}} and {{staging}}. The {{master}} is write protected, allows only pull requests and the merge is made using the {{squash}} strategy.

Given that, when creating each new pull request, the automatic description of the pull requests contains LOTS of commits from the {{staging}} branch. They were merged already, however, since they do not exist in the {{master}} branch (each merged pull request results in a single merge commit) the list keeps growing and growing. On each pull request we have to clear that description and leave only relevant commits which is a tedious work.

Maybe we're doing something wrong? However this sounds like a bug ;/
fields.summary: Growing commit list on each pull request having squash merge strategy on master branch
Repository Downloads CURL command is not working

fields.description:
# New private repo: https://bitbucket.org/geodepe/myspring/src/master/
# added 2 text files.
# Checked out to local system using SourceTree. Made some changes, commit, push.
# Bitbucket shows updated listing in <>Source. And Commits show correct commits.\\
When I select the repo/<>Source, I see a listing of my files. Great!!!
# Now, I select one of the text files in the listing, but I get error message\\
"Hmm... can't find that one\\
That file or directory doesn’t exist. Go back to the previous page and try another one."
# So, I hit the back button as instructed and the listing is missing my files except for README.md.
# Next, I panic ("Where are my files") ... select <>Source again ... ok I see my files listed ... Great!!!
# Goto 5.

Please help ... I am stuck in a loop.
fields.summary: Bitbucket may have lost my files. Stuck in Loop.

fields.description: This only started few hours ago. Each time push a new folder to a repos I can't see it's content from bitbucket web ui.
fields.summary: Unable to see content of new folder from bitbucket web interface
"We hit a glitch and couldn't clone the repository. Please rerun the pipeline." error received with new project.

fields.description:
Environment: latest windows 10 freshly installed reinstalled from scratch + latest windows git client installed with all the defaults:

When trying to access my repo pops up a window to enter credentials which are not accepted:

git.exe pull -v --progress "origin"

remote: Invalid username or password. If your organization manages your account or you've enabled two-step verification, create an app password to log in: https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/9DJmMQ\\
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/.../'

I do NOT use the two-step verification.

If I close that window, it proceeds with command CLI stdin wrapper, which accepts everything, but the passwords aren't stored in the windows credential manager

I can also run git clone https://username:password@... , so the credentials that I am entering are ok.

"git credential-manager version" reports\\
Git Credential Manager for Windows version 1.16.2
fields.summary: Credential manager failure

fields.description:
BCLOUD-7396

The problem in that thread is still going on. It's kind of a big deal. What are we to do?
fields.summary: The text editor is losing line breaks. 2

fields.description: Issue BCLOUD-3349 is not resolved (and it is not clear why it has been marked so). Lots of people would appreciate fi you could add an option to remove a wiki page.
fields.summary: Add a simple option to remove a wiki page

fields.description:
Currently, deployment steps cannot be run in parallel. However, in some cases, deployment is made to multiple production environments.

It would be suitable to deploy to all these environments in parallel, saving developer time.
fields.summary: Allow deployment steps to run in parallel

fields.description:
Seems there is a bit of discrepancy between updated tasks on a pull request vs. pull request overview dashboard page.

# Create pull request with tasks
# Complete one or more tasks.
# Update the pull request via a commit
# Commits should -reset- tasks, and show comments as outdated
# The pull request page and the dashboard overview should show the tasks not completed

per customer report:

"The dashboard will show a count of 1 open task (if I don't filter). Then if you click into the PR, the detail page for the PR shows "All Tasks Resolved" which is also confirmed if you click that link (which shows each task with a checked box)."
fields.summary: Discrepancy between updated tasks on pull request view and pull request overview dashboard

fields.description: While signing up for an Atlassian account via a Bitbucket invite, I found that Tester/QA is missing as an option in the role selection during the new account flow.
fields.summary: New account on boarding role choices should include Tester

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Using PR merge API doesn't enforce or overrides the "merge_strategy" field, the API follows the default merge strategy set in the repository settings.\\
To add, the API doesn't also overrides the "message" field.

*Merge API:* https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/merge

h3. *How to reproduce*
# Change your repository default merge strategy (under your repository > settings) to "Merge commit"
# Create a new Pull request
# Use the API CURL command below to merge (using "squash") your PR by providing the PR ID\\
*Sample CURL command:*

{code}
#!curl

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/username/repositoryurl/pullrequests/pr_Id/merge \
  --header 'authorization: Basic <HASH>' \
  --header 'cache-control: no-cache' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{
    "pullrequest_merge_parameters": {
        "type": "pullrequest",
        "message": "Sample commit message",
        "close_source_branch": "false",
        "merge_strategy": "squash"
    }
}'
{code}

h3. *Expected Results*
The merge API should overrides / enforce the "merge_strategy" to "squash" the commit set in the API

h3. *Actual Results*
The merge API is using the default merge strategy set in the repository settings

h3. *Workaround*
For now, we can manually set the merge strategy in repository settings to change
fields.summary: Merge Pull Request API is not overriding merge strategy

fields.description:
Take the following scenario: approve/merge 5 pull requests into the develop branch which is automatically configured to build on each push to this branch.

There's now 5 builds running simultaneously.

Would be nice if there was a way to prevent builds by either a specific string in the commit message or a option in the UI.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent a pipelines build from a commit message or option

fields.description:
Hi,

When a new commit is done on a PR, the system automatically marked the PR as unapproved for reviewers.\\
The message is : "John Doe marked the pull request as UNAPPROVED"\\
It is a bit confusing because the user didn't do anything, it is done automaticaly.

The message should be something like: "Due to new commit on the PR, the system marked it as unapproved for reviewers"

Cheers,\\
Julien
fields.summary: Improve message displayed when approvals are automatically invalidated

fields.description:

Console output:

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am able to successfully revert the changes from the target branch but when i modify the file in source branch and create a pull request to merge new changes in target branch, it doesnt detect any changes in PR hence unable to merge any PR post reverting it.
fields.summary: Pull Request Revert functionality not working

fields.description:
GitHub have this feature - you can put all the [GitHub specific files|https://help.github.com/articles/setting-guidelines-for-repository-contributors/] to the {{.github/}} folder of your project.

The {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} is Bitbucket specific file. *Can pipelines search for its YML file in the {{.bitbucket/pipelines.yml}} location too?*

Why this is a good feature.

* I have two shell files per project - {{.bitbucket/pipelines-build.sh}} and {{.bitbucket/pipelines-deploy.sh}}. I wish I could put the YML file into the same folder.
* If they all in the same folder - I can safely put them into the git subrepo, or npm package, or else. Basically, this would allow me to write the scripts once and reuse! Otherwise, I have to go through *all* my repos and update the three files as needed, which is time consuming.
fields.summary: Use ./.bitbucket/ folder to locate pipelines.yml

fields.description:
I was wondering whether it possible to have the pipelines enhanced such that a deploy step could be re-run.

The case that I am after a solution for is when the build of artifacts is successful, and the deploy is successful. But at some point the environment parameters used during deploy need to change. It would be awesome if we could re-run a deploy stage.

It could also be that re-running a deploy for an older version could be used to "rollback" a deployment.
fields.summary: Re-Run Deploy Step

fields.description:
Hi there,

For some pull requests, there are long boilerplate files that nevertheless must be committed.  It would be nice to have for the web interface, in the settings menu for that file, to be able to collapse all of the code lines in that file so that the only thing visible is the filename header that contains menu options for that file.  I have included an image to make clear what I mean by "file header".

Thanks,\\
Solar!880956022-Screen%20Shot%202018-07-26%20at%2012.18.40%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hide all lines from pull request file

fields.description:
In scenarios where a username is added in a projects by mistake, the user will start seeing a lot of things on their Dashboard under "Your work" and "Repositories" tab.

It would be nice to have a way to contact the repo owner to warn them about it.
fields.summary: Create a way to contact a repo owner directly

fields.description:
I just want to be able to see all branches when I click on branches. I don't care if they are merged or active. I don't even know what active means. When I click on "Branches" I expect to see all branches. I can decide what to do with them from there.\\
It would be helpful to know if branches share the same hash or not though. But please, list all the branches on the same view/page.
fields.summary: Display all branches regardless of active or merged

fields.description:
Currently it's difficult to view prior comments together with the current version of a file while reviewing a pull request.

If you add some comments and then a new version of the file is committed, you can only view those comments via the button called "[N] prior comments" at the top of the file.

*Use Case:*

* As a pull request reviewer, I want to see comments left on prior versions of a file and compare to the current version to see if the comments have been addressed. I need to be able to see prior comments and the current version simultaneously, as easily and quickly as possible. I must be able to scroll around in the current version, without losing sight of the prior comments.

*Problems:*

# The prior comments are displayed in a modal popup dialog, and you can't easily see the current version of the file beneath it;
# You can't move the dialog out of the way, and can't even scroll the main window to see different lines of code.
# This makes it difficult to review pull requests having multiple iterations of changes to a single file.
# As a result, it's easy for old comments to get forgotten and they can end up not being addressed, resulting in the need for additional pull requests.

*Suggested Improvements:*

As a workaround, I usually have to open two browser windows for the same pull request, one for viewing the current version, and the other for viewing the Activity stream (which includes prior comments). This is a cumbersome way to work. I think it could be improved significantly.

A UI design that IMO is significantly better than Bitbucket is how comments work in Google Sheets. You click the comments icon in the top right corner, which opens a list of all the comments. You can interact with the comments, but you still have full access to view/scroll/edit the sheet. When you click a comment it takes you directly to the location in the sheet.

(Also, you can Resolve or Re-open individual comments -- this would be a great feature for Bitbucket.)

I'd like to see Bitbucket improve this functionality to make code reviews easier. The current implementation is difficult, inefficient, and frustrating to use. We need a solution where you can view comments on prior versions and still work with the current version, without resorting to a kludgy hack of opening multiple windows for the same PR.
fields.summary: Pull requests: Prior comments should be easier to see while reviewing current version

fields.description:
h1. *Summary*
When creating or editing a pull request, users are allowed to enter "*javascript:alert(123)*" string and able to run a pop-up or script.\\
This might cause a possible XSS scripting.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new Pull request in your repo
# Type "javascript:alert(123)" in the description box
# Highlight the "javascript:alert(123)" string > click "Add link" (Under menu bar)
# Click the string "javascript:alert(123)" > paste the string "javascript:alert(123)".
# Click the string "javascript:alert(123)" > Click "Open Link"

h1. *Expected results*
Should not be able to run/execute any JS scripting

h1. *Actual results*
Able to alert pop-up

h1. *Workaround*
None at the moment
fields.summary: Pull request XSS scripting

fields.description:
The same way we keep the private key on {{/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/id_rsa}}, we could have the public key. This is useful when provisioning virtual machines: the public key can be specified, so Bitbucket Pipelines can connect and config the virtual machine.

Today's alternative is to manually add the key to the repository or expose it as an environment environment.
fields.summary: Save Bitbucket Pipelines SSH public key on pipeline filesystem

fields.description: Expose commiter e-mail in Bitbucket Pipelines as an environment variable. It allows the pipeline to deploy customized notifications.
fields.summary: Expose commiter e-mail in Bitbucket Pipelines as an environment variable

fields.description:
STR

# Fork an existing repository (A) to a new one (B) via Bitbucket Cloud
# Push a new branch to (B)
# Open browser and navigate to (B) repo on Bitbucket Cloud
# Select 'Branches' from sidebar
# Locate new branch from step 2 in list, select 'Create' from 'Pull request' column

Result:\\
Note destination is defaulted to (A) using (A)'s main branch

Expected:\\
Destination defaults to (B) using (B)'s main branch

Comments:\\
If you repeat steps 1-4 from above, then:

# Locate new branch from step 2 in list, select branch from 'Branch' column
# Select 'Create pull request'

Note destination defaults to (B) using (B)'s main branch, as expected

Not sure if this is intentionally different, since submitting a PR to a fork parent is perfectly valid. It's just the default is inconsistent depending on where I create the PR from, and it isn't clear why.
fields.summary: Creating PR from Branch list defaults to fork parent

fields.description:
First we got 404 on branch which should be created, then an exception occurred and web view freeze on "Creating pull request..." step.

Console Error:

{code}

fields.description:
Would like to see a much more detailed pipeline usage for organization.

Currently it's *(only)* possible to see usage for current month.\\
If checked the day after "reset day", it isn't possible to see previous month(s).\\
And that makes it harder to improve our build times.

Would be nice to see average build time per repo as well. To know what the median of builds are for a repo, to pinpoint where the issue occurred.
fields.summary: Pipeline usage overview

fields.description:
Even though the commit has a proper date (correctly displayed in "Commits" or "Branches" view), the Pipelines status bar still shows is as "Invalid date by <commit author>".

I checked a number of my repositories which have Pipelines enabled and identified a pattern: whenever there is a manual step(s) still to be triggered, it is "Invalid date...", however if there are no manual steps in the configuration or all manual steps have been executed already, it shows correct message.\\
Also, in my case all manual steps are used for deployments (i.e. have {{deployment: <stage name>}} in the yaml config)
fields.summary: Pipelines status bar shows "Invalid date" message

fields.description:
The way we work is that:

* No PR can be merged till it's approved 2 times
* People should not review PRs that have 2 approvals already
* Anyone can review any PR (so listing certain people when making a PR isn't done)

To help with this workflow, it would be very helpful if the PR page of a repo had a filter for number of approvals. Then, I could easily see which ones still need to be reviewed.
fields.summary: Filter PR list by number of approvals

fields.description: While scrolling though a file with a lot of changes, I often find myself uncertain what file I am looking at and need to scroll back to the top of the file to figure this out. Can you fix the filename to the top of the screen for the file you are scrolling through?
fields.summary: Fix title of current file in diff to top of screen

fields.description:
I currently use a single Bitbucket account for all my coding needs, both personal and professional - this means I don't need to change accounts a couple of times a day to achieve my goals.

However, that also means I get work notifications in my personal address.

GitHub solves that by allowing me to assign a different notification email to each Team I'm part of. While that's still suboptimal, it solves most of the cases.

I would suggest to include in Bitbucket the ability to configure a different email on a per-team and per-repository basis.
fields.summary: Configure notification email destination per repository

fields.description:
The word {{OPEN}} for PR status is mistranslated in Japanese on the PR pages https://bitbucket.org/.../.../pull-requests/ as of 2018/07/26.

bq. !2357658980-2018-07-26-111620.jpg|thumbnail!


{{OPEN}} is translated reasonablly in individual PR pages (https://bitbucket.org/.../.../pull-requests/1234)

bq. !632883410-2018-07-26-111606.jpg|thumbnail!


The Japanese word !1180665577-open.jpg|thumbnail! is a verb that means "to open", "to give access" or something like that.

Since {{OPEN}} is for PR state in this context,  I suppose it should be !661358252-open2.jpg|thumbnail!,  which is adjective that means ({{not closed}})
fields.summary: Wrong translation of "OPEN" for PR state in Japanese

fields.description:
Could you please drop the red highlighting from the "we're changing our IP addresses" remote text feedback when using git command line to push into repos? For most users there should be no action needed and, to my eye, it's a bit much.

Cheers,

Jim
fields.summary: Please Drop Red Highlighting from Git Remote Messages

fields.description:
The _blame_ button was renamed to _annotate_ at some point.

This causes confusion considering the recognised term is actually _blame_ especially as the command you ultimately run is _git blame_.

Could we please think about renaming it?
fields.summary: Rename the Annotate button to Blame

fields.description:
I have a repo which has a number of sub-folders which are themselves self-contained demo projects.  There is a README.md at the root of the repo but I also have README.md in the sub-folders as each sub-folder needs a readme.

Bug: is that in the bitbucket web portal source view does not show the README.md in the sub-folders.

Have left as a major as why are files being hidden???

Cloning the repo locally gets all README.md files in correct locations.  So is just a grid view issue on the web page..

Feature Request: Would also be nice if in the sub-folder the README.md content was displayed like it does in the repo root...
fields.summary: Source View subfolder/README.md files not listed.

fields.description:
h2. Problem
When open on Google Chrome page 'Boards' in my repo with trello, page start growing and show second vertical scroll in browser window. After a few seconds the page becomes very large in height and all start freezing. After minute I can't work :(\\
On last week I hadn't this issue.\\
On latest Firefox I don't see that bug.

h2. System:
Windows 10 Home x64 1803

h2. Browser:
Google Chrome x64 67.0.3396.99\\
on Firefox 61.0.1 haven't this bug.
fields.summary: Infinite growing page with trello's borders and freezing.

fields.description:
Files in UTF-8 (without BOM) encoding get correctly interpreted by the Online Editor for viewing, but when saving changes, the encoding is lost.

Steps to reproduce:

* Commit file in utf-8 without bom and special characters (äöüè...)
* Open file in online editor from bitbucket and add text and commit.
* After saving, the file is no longer in utf-8. Even when not changing the lines with special characters, the special characters are in a different encoding after the online-commit.

Experienced in chrome, if that changes anything.
fields.summary: Online Editor loses UTF-8 encoding
Pipeline fails on a @babel/register

fields.description:

user login and complete actions of user on organization.

can you please confirm for these type of actions is there any special Integration& plugin available on  Bitbucket cloud.
fields.summary: Add clones and push,pull and clone to audit logging

fields.description:
a maybe new issue: create my README.md file... it worked fine some weeks ago... but now, on source page, it looks like there is no lines separation (all code in one line) and then, the mark of this file doesn't occur on source page. Well... try to edit it from bitbucket... at edit time, all lines are back... close edit page... same... it looks like someone newbie dev touch at the code of show markup README file.

Could you please fix this issue (before next 2 years) and, when you touch something, just check you don't brake something ?

thank you very much

fields.description:
Hello,

I have just signed up for bitbucket and was hold back about three minutes clicking on traffic signs, solving at least 7 of these puzzles.

Please find a different captcha or bot-stopping method, since reCaptcha is no fun anymore, apart from the fact, that I feel beeing abused by solving riddles and beeing tracked by third parties without my consent, just for wanting to sign up with your service.

Best Regards,

Georg
fields.summary: reCaptcha annoyance

fields.description: When a user that hasn't logged into Bitbucket since the upgrade to Atlassian account and was not migrated yet tries to log in using the primary email, it would be great if the system automatically detects that the email already exists for a Bitbucket account on the login page to avoid any confusion.
fields.summary: Detect that the email already exists for an account on the login page

fields.description:
Scenario:

* Several files exist in a repo with tab characters.
* Developer uses an IDE to convert all tabs to spaces across several large files.
* Change is committed and pushed to bitbucket.
* Bitbucket is zoomed-in using the browser zoom feature.

Problem:\\
The large amount of whitespace changes cause rendering issues within Google Chrome, causing the page to become unresponsive, and elements to disappear and jump in and out of view as you scroll down the page. You can click the "Ignore Whitespace" option within Bitbucket, which fixes the issue, so long as you can manage to find the options menu (the rendering bugs in Chrome prevent it from appearing). There is no way to Ignore Whitespace as the default behavior.

Suggested Solution:\\
Provide an option to Ignore Whitespace by default when reviewing commits and pull requests. Also, work with browser developers to fix the underlying rendering issue.
fields.summary: Page doesn't render when a pull request contain too many whitespace changes

fields.description:
For users that do not have a team, you will get a strange blank _Teams_ screen by doing the following:

(Make sure Source browser experiment is turned on)

# Go to _user avatar > Bitbucket settings_
# Click on _Teams_

You'll be given a blank teams screen.

!3531965687-Screen%20Shot%202018-07-23%20at%2010.26.21%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Small UX issue with empty teams
